file_content.text: Yes, Master Jedi? Is there something you want?
I wanted to make sure you're comfortable. Have everything you need?
Just checking in.
Well, no... but then again, I never do. That's field medicine.
I haven't been feeling well. Thought I should visit the best medic on board.
[Flirt] An exam.
Oh? Let's have a look.
You're a terrible liar. Other than that, you're fine.
I've heard a kiss will make anything feel better.
A theory of Doc's, I'm guessing.
I was hoping for something a bit more thorough.
I'm not that kind of doctor.
You need to respect my crew.
You need to respect my crew.
That business with Doc when you came on board. You were out of line.
You agreed with me then. Don't let his sweet talk get to you.
I see. Have to stand by your pal, right? Even if he's an idiot.
Doc is an amateur. In emergency medicine, of all things!
You've got an attitude problem. I want to correct that, right now.
I want respect.
Because I speak my mind? Because I hold others accountable?
I believe in professionalism. Integrity. Doing a job right the first time, to the best of your ability.
That's why I joined the Protectors. We don't wait for civilians to get hurt--we stop it from happening.
From what I've seen, the Protectors couldn't have asked for a better chief medic.
Sounds like a good fit.
They could. I try to make sure they don't have to.
How long have you been with the Protectors? Did you join right out of medical school?
What did you do before?
I wish. Wasted a decade of my life in an emergency room on Corellia first.
During the battle there, civilians came in looking like soldiers. Blaster burns, shrapnel, missing limbs... there's no excuse for that.
It must get exhausting, being perfect all the time. I don't know how you do it.
You're so conceited!
I'm not perfect. That's why I work so hard.
It's all a matter of commitment. The Protectors have it. We'll see about you and your crew.
I'm sorry, Master Jedi. I'm not much for small talk. Or big talk.
It's my job to save lives, not make excuses. If you need a mag-scanner and a kolto drip to do that, then you're not trying.
Some people say I have a bad bedside manner. But I'd rather have a live patient who hates me than a dead one who doesn't.
